Key Match Events: Ryan Christie scored the first goal for Scotland after 58 minutes.
Che Adams scored a spectacular volley five minutes from time to secure the victory for Scotland.
Leeds defender Liam Cooper limped off with 12 minutes to play due to an injury.
Scotland ended their seven-game winless run with this victory.
Pre-Game Insights: This match was a penultimate warm-up clash for Scotland before facing Germany in the opening match of Euro 2024.
Scotland's winless run finally ended at the eighth attempt.
Post-Match Reflections: Scotland manager Steve Clarke watched the game from the stands.
The performance was underwhelming despite the victory, with Scotland struggling to convert their chances.
Liam Cooper's injury added to the team's concerns ahead of the Euro 2024 opener against Germany.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Scotland played in their pastel blue away kit.
Gibraltar, ranked 203 in the world, were not expected to pose much of a challenge.
Gibraltar's team included a mix of experienced players and young talents like 17-year-old James Scanlon from Manchester United.
